summary: "Freakshow Auditions" As Todd expands the Freakshow, he needs to find new performers. Garry "Stretch" Turner, with the stretchiest skin in the world, makes an appearance. AMC Original.
The Amazing Boobzilla performs, and Ali goes through surgery with the support of her Freakshow family.
A tattoo event at the Freakshow brings in inked-up people from all over the world. Meanwhile, Creature looks for a place to live.
Asia tries to convince a seasoned sideshow veteran to teach her a dangerous stunt.
The Freakshow travels to Gibsonton, Fla., to learn about its rich history as a carnival town and to try to revive it with a performance.
Asia looks for an apartment, and Todd learns a dark secret about a performer named Lobster Boy.
Morgue attempts a bed-of-box-cutters stunt; George looks for love.
The gang attend the campout nuptials of two drifters. Meanwhile, Ali and Matt encounter marital strife.
Creature meets his estranged daughter face-to-face and relives his break-dancing past. Meanwhile, Todd tries to pull off a surprise 21st-birthday party for Asia.
Space Cowboy goes after a world record; Danielle invites neighbors over for dinner.

A chronicle of life at California's Venice Beach Freakshow, a repository for unique performers, creatures and artifacts, begins with proprietor Todd trying to recruit a living giant and a bearded lady and get them to participate in a birthday party for the two-headed bearded dragon.
Competitors hone their skills for sword-swallower's day.
"Two Headed Baby" "The Lobster Boy" joins Todd on a family trip to obtain a two-headed baby and a day of roller skating causes panic for one of the performers. AMC Original.
"Human Pin Cushion" Murrugun defies the limits of the human body with his human pin cushion stunt. Creature attempts to reunite with his estranged five-year-old daughter. AMC Original.
A Freakshow-style wedding is thrown by Todd, while a pain-proof man makes an appearance.
Ears, nipples and eye sockets are employed during a strongman competition, while a new performer evokes empathy with an emotional tale.
Jesse the Half Man and Jim the Armless Wonder demonstrate their unique abilities, while Todd wrestles with a difficult decision.
When Todd considers banning the word "normal," entertainers from around the world come to Venice to back him, and once there perform their specialty acts and stage a Freak Parade.
In the Season 2 premiere, tensions run high as Penny's first surgery approaches. Later, a family trip to the pumpkin patch lifts Penny's spirits, but fear sets in the night before her procedure.
The day of Penny's spinal-decompression surgery has arrived, leading Terra and Joe to worry as they head to the hospital. Later, complications could stall the procedure before it even begins.

Joe wants to surprise Terra for Penny's homecoming following her first surgery, but an early release could spoil his plan. Later, Joe and Terra have their first experience with suppositories as Penny's recovery begins.

Terra confronts Tonya about not visiting Penny while she was in the hospital; and Joe doesn't react the way that Terra hoped he would when she brings up having another baby. Later, Terra accompanies Traci to her Ultrasound appointment, where they receive shocking news.
Joe's left in charge of Penny for the first time while Terra throws Traci's baby shower. Later, Joe becomes angry with Terra when she discusses intimate details of their relationship at the party.

Terra's releasing a children's album to expand her brand and wants Joe to be included in the video shoot, but she worries that he won't make it back from his band's performance in Arizona in time to participate.

Joe plans a camping trip to get away for a few nights alone with Terra, but she is nervous about being away from Penny for the first time. She reluctantly agrees to leave her with nanny Olevia and hatches a plan to convince Joe to have another child.
Terra and Joe cut short their camping trip when nanny Olevia stops answering their phone calls and they become worried about Penny.
Terra convinces Joe to start practicing yoga to help relieve his back pain. Later, Joe's visit to the doctor ends with news that may jeopardize their plan to try for another baby.
Terra's upcoming performance to promote her new children's album prompts Joe to make a bet with her that his band's gig at a bar will have a better turnout than her showcase.

The pregnancy of Terra Jolé of "Little Women: LA" is documented in this series, which begins with Terra and Joe receiving disturbing news about their unborn child's health. As a result, Terra undergoes medical tests. Later, the doctor makes a surprising decision about her due date.
Terra asks her mother to fly out for the baby's birth; and Joe finally asks Terra to marry him.

Terra reunites with her besties Traci and Tonya to tell them about Joe's big proposal. Terra and Joe try their hardest to get everything in order before the baby arrives, but when a very pregnant Terra realizes they're not totally ready for the baby, she has a break down.

Tonya gives Terra some mommy advice to ease her nerves. With the final countdown upon them, Joe and Terra celebrate their last night alone together and anticipate how their lives will change as they set off on their new journey as parents.

Terra experiences a meltdown in her hospital room before her surgery begins. After the birth, the baby is rushed to the neonatal intensive-care unit for treatment. Later, Terra and Joe decide upon a name for the baby.
Terra and Joe adjust to life at home with a baby and take their daughter to her first pediatrician appointment to help understand the challenges she may face.

Terra worries about taking Penny to see a neurologist and struggles with her new role as mom. Meanwhile, Joe hopes a visit from his cousin Sonny will lend a helping hand, but after their task to buy a car becomes an afternoon at a bar, Terra realizes she may need professional help.

Terra convinces Joe to make a get-fit pact when she realizes she still doesn't fit into any of her pre-maternity clothes; Joe reflects on all the surgeries he endured as a child and hopes Penny's impending genetics test results won't reveal a similar fate.
Terra and Joe receive the long-awaited news of Penny's genetic test results. Meanwhile, the exhausted new parents prepare to host a Sip 'n See party for friends to meet Penny.
Joe feels pressure to make Terra's first Mother's Day a success, but Penny requires 24-hour care and an exhausted Terra begs Joe to watch Penny all by himself for the afternoon.

Terra makes it to the semi-finals of "Dancing With the Stars," but multiple health issues and waning support from friends increases the pressure. Later, Christy preps for a cutting-edge surgery that has never been performed on a little person; and Elena, Tonya and Briana go to a comedy show that ends in tears.

Briana worries she might have postpartum depression; and Christy's recovery is even harder than anticipated. Later, Terra wishes she was back in the ballroom and struggles to fulfill her promises of making her family, friends and health a priority.

After a tough pregnancy, Jasmine's delivery isn't as easy as she hoped; and Briana is rushed to the hospital with severe pain. Later, Elena and Terra have not spoken to each other in over a month, but the pair go ice skating in hopes of making amends.

Terra throws a vision-board party and confronts Briana about rumors that she tried to steal Terra's manager. Later, Jasmine and Elena are approached by Briana's friend Lisa; and Tonya and Kerwin argue about the expectations they have for each other.

The genetics results to determine if Elena's twins have dwarfism are revealed. Later, Lisa tells Briana that Matt's behavior makes her feel uncomfortable, but Matt spins the blame back on her; Jasmine and Elena end up in the middle of Briana's mess; and the group go to Monster Jam.

Terra and Tonya rally at the L.A. Women's March, but Briana bails because she thinks Terra is going for the wrong reasons. Later, Christy and Todd seek medical weight-loss advice; Elena gets heartbreaking news and heads to Russia to be with her family; and Tonya lashes out over the legitimacy of Mary's couture line.

Terra belittles Briana in front of the gals. Later, Elena criticizes Mary's couture-clothing designs; Briana tries to advance her modeling career by setting up a boudoir photo shoot; and Terra invites the ladies to the Sexual Health Expo, where Briana accuses Jasmine of joining Terra's clique rather than acting as a true friend to her.

Mary holds runway auditions for her London fashion show, where Elena says she's not authentic; Terra regrets inviting both ladies to an upcoming art show; Briana sees photos from her racy photo shoot; Christy and Todd receive his pre-op test results; and Briana arranges a lunch to ease tension with Jasmine, but it backfires as Jasmine is ready to end their friendship altogether.

Terra's dream of writing a book is becoming real as she meets with her editor for the first time, but not everyone is happy for her; Elena thinks Terra doesn't make her family her first priority and questions making her the godmother to her twin boys; and Briana is accused of shady business practices by Christy and finds out Maverick may need an invasive surgery.

In the fifth-season opener, Elena hosts a spa day for the ladies, but Briana doesn't show up, so her friends worry about her; and Christy and Terra remain at odds over the tea incident. Later, Joe reveals how he really feels about Christy.

Christy feels left out following a tense spa retreat; the ladies attend a drag-queen convention; and Terra receives big news at her OBGYN appointment. Later, the group wonders about Briana's whereabouts.

Briana deals with the emotional trauma of her near-death experience after spending eight days in the hospital. Later, Christy faces the consequences of betraying Briana; Tonya and Kerwin move in together; and Jasmine shares news related to her health.

Jasmine hosts Briana's baby shower but has doubts about how many guests will show up in light of Briana's feud with the other ladies. Later, Christy considers reconciling with Briana; Tonya's past with Jaa resurfaces; and Elena's rushed to the hospital when her blood pressure skyrockets.

Elena's released from the hospital after giving birth, but her twins remain in the NICU. Later, Christy's daughter is rushed to the hospital; Terra worries about Tonya's logo for her new active-wear clothing line; and Kerwin gives Tonya an ultimatum, demanding that she cut business ties with her ex-boyfriend.

Tonya's plan to prove to Kerwin that she doesn't have feelings for her ex backfires. Later, Elena's twins are released from the hospital; and Tonya invites the ladies to build houses for charity, but drama between them threatens to derail the event.

Tonya plans a Western-themed party for Kerwin. Later, Terra learns she's not invited to the bash, leading her to arrange a secret meeting with Tonya's daughter; and Briana blames Christy when she ends up in legal trouble.

Briana suspects Christy's involvement in her legal troubles and wonders about her sobriety. Later, Terra reveals secrets that Tonya's daughter told her; Jasmine voices her opinion about Matt's infidelity; and Matt and Briana head to the hospital after another health scare.

Briana recovers from her difficult pregnancy while her baby's monitored in the NICU. Later, Elena and Terra plan a murder-mystery party; the ladies wonder about Christy's involvement in Briana's legal troubles; and Terra takes a risk for an opportunity.
Terra goes dancing with a friend from New York; and Jasmine confronts Christy about meddling with Briana's life. Later, Christy shows up at Tonya's photo shoot with an unexpected visitor.

In the Season 4 premiere, Jasmine hosts a party for the women to share tips about raising kids, but Elena's left off the guest list because she's not a mom. Later, Briana and Matt have relationship issues; and Tonya takes the ladies to a Motocross race that ends in chaos.

Elena has a preview party to test her new beauty products, but Jasmine becomes angry when she's left off the guest list. Elsewhere, an unexpected family member goes behind Briana's back and asks Terra and Christy to help bring her back to the family.

Briana's family reaches out in hopes of reconciling, but Matt insists their children will never meet her family. Elsewhere, Elena decides to tell Preston she wants to try for a baby; Jasmine may need to move out of the state so her husband can find a job; and Tonya gets vocal with Briana about Matt's mind games when the girls go apple picking.

Tonya's daughter's father visits Los Angeles; Christy is concerned Todd being overweight may affect their chances of adopting a child; and Jasmine debates whether to try for a second baby. Meanwhile, Briana keeps a huge secret from Matt.

Jasmine throws a couples party in hopes of pleasing Elena; Tonya feels like she's being left out because of her complicated relationship; and Briana and Christy try to mend their friendship. Later, Terra and Tonya get in a huge fight when Tonya puts a man before her friend.

The ladies wonder if they've lost a friend after Terra's fight with Tonya and Elena. Later, Christy gathers everyone for a day of pizza-making; and Elena receives unexpected news that will change her life.

Jasmine offers to throw Briana a bachelorette party, but she wants Briana to invite all the ladies; Terra and Tonya make amends; Tonya learns she needs to undergo surgery; and Elena finds out she's pregnant. Later, Christy hosts a housewarming party, but an unexpected guest puts a damper on the evening.

The ladies go to Cancún for Briana's bachelorette party; Elena struggles to keep her pregnancy a secret; and Briana becomes upset after realizing Tonya and Terra still don't approve of her relationship with Matt. Later, Christy hires a stripper, causing Briana to have a meltdown.

Briana's bachelorette party in Mexico continues, but the ladies can't enjoy the trip due to Briana's skepticism of who supports her marriage. Later, Terra learns that Ali told Briana she and Tonya don't want to be there; and Christy's called out for acting two-faced.

Terra invites the ladies to go country-line dancing after Briana continues to ignore her apologies. Later, Briana makes a shocking announcement; and Terra and Christy end up in a fight that could tear the group apart.

Season 3 begins with the ladies going on a wine safari tour that quickly turns sour. Briana and Terra introduce new friends, Jasmine and Brittney, to the group, unaware that their paths have crossed with several of the girls before. Meanwhile, Christy and Todd move forward with their plans for in vitro fertilization; and Briana tries to rekindle a relationship with Matt.

Jasmine wants to win the girls over by hosting an extravagant party, but her husband's recent unemployment threatens to disrupt her plans. Meanwhile, Christy undergoes a painful IVF procedure; and Terra reveals a shocking secret that could permanently destroy a relationship.

Briana takes Jasmine to Seattle to meet Matt; Christy and Todd struggle with intimacy when the IVF process puts pressure on their relationship; Brittney's dad throws a "Leaving the Nest" barbecue for her; Jasmine confronts Tonya about problems from their past.

Christy and Todd's anniversary party turns sour when Christy's mother learns of their pregnancy plans. Meanwhile, Elena discloses the dirty details of her relationship with David to Preston; and Tonya throws a graduation party for her daughter.

Brittney flirts with a guy who has boyfriend potential; Briana takes her relationship with Matt to the next level; Tonya lays her heart on the line and talks to Jaa about marriage; Christy struggles with the physical and emotional pain of IVF; Tonya and Terra bring everyone together for a fun beach bonfire, but things quickly heat up as issues from the past are brought to the surface.

Briana gets a life-changing opportunity to sign with a music agent, but when she's put to the test with music producer Kerry Gordy her vocal talent comes into question. Meanwhile, Christy is recruited to do a comedy music video, but she must get Terra and the other girls to participate.

Briana confronts Terra about how unkind she is to Matt. Terra is shocked, and she and the girls decide that Briana's relationship with Matt is unhealthy. Meanwhile, Elena and Preston make a surprise announcement; and Tonya creates a workout routine to help little people stay in shape.

Christy and Todd undergo an artificial insemination procedure and receive their pregnancy test results; Elena plans a special event; Briana learns she was the target of trash talk; tempers flare on the set of Tonya's workout video and they threaten to shut down the project.

Christy seeks medical advice for her excruciating neck pain. Unfortunately, the threat of additional surgery brings up horrible memories of physical abuse from a previous relationship many years ago. Meanwhile, Briana takes the next step in her music career by working with producers and songwriters on her debut single; and a group trip to the horse track results in the ladies confronting Briana about why she flaked out on Tonya's workout video.

The women bust out the bikinis and booze to celebrate Elena's upcoming vow renewal with the bachelorette party she never had. As the girls play steamy bachelorette party games, Brittney surprises the girls when she breaks down over her ex-boyfriend. Meanwhile, Briana drops the mother of all secrets that could cause a major rift between the ladies forever.

Season 2 begins with the ladies embarking on a booze cruise but it's far from smooth sailing. Meanwhile, Traci accuses Briana of lying about why she didn't attend Traci's wedding; Terra gets an offer that could change her career; and a pregnancy test comes up positive for one lucky lady.

Tonya learns that Brianna and Trevore have been talking behind her back, which leads to an explosive lunch with Trevore and his mom. When Brianna learns her daughter is being bullied, she struggles with whether to tell her she is a little person.
Christy and Brianna question Terra's motivations and friendships with other women. Meanwhile, Traci struggles with envy; and Elena's burlesque performance exposes her trust issues with her husband.

Traci and Tonya begin to question Terra's loyalty; Traci gets the news she's been dreaming of; Briana takes a chance on a guy she met online; Christy hosts a barbecue where some of the secrets she's been spreading around the group come back to haunt her.

Terra's brother visits and he forces her to tell their mother that she is pregnant. Meanwhile, Briana confronts her family on why they aren't willing to meet her new long-distance boyfriend; and she goes on stage to sing at an open mic night.

Christy and Todd face unfortunate news and decide to explore alternative options for having a child; Elena decides to have an uncommon cosmetic enhancement; Terra tries to hook up Tonya with a new man by throwing a "Used-Date Party."
The ladies try to mend their relationships after Tonya's "Used-Date Party" ends in a nasty brawl; Christy, Briana and Lila bring the girls together for a fun race; Lila throws a cocktail party.
Terra treats the gang to a weekend on Catalina Island, but the news that they'll be roughing it on this vacation turns half the group into extremely unhappy campers.
Christy and Todd explore IVF after months of trying to get pregnant; Briana invites the girls to see a friend's comedy show; Elena throws a housewarming party that quickly turns ugly.
The ladies visit New Orleans with their husbands and embrace the Big Easy lifestyle, but tempers flare when Briana's desire to see a psychic infuriates Tonya.

The lives of a group of girlfriends who happen to be little people are chronicled. In the opener, the ladies enroll in a sexy dance class and celebrate the end of a marriage. Meanwhile, one gal drops some hints to her boyfriend that she wants to get married.

Christy shops for an engagement ring, even though Todd hasn't yet proposed. Meanwhile, the ladies prepare for a pinup-themed photo shoot; Traci reveals her wedding date; and Elena shares an emotional story about growing up as a little person in Russia.

Christy and Traci's bridal battle intensifies when Christy steals Traci's spotlight at a wine-tasting party. Meanwhile, Elena visits a doctor to find out what type of dwarfism she has and what potential problems might arise during pregnancy. Later, Traci invites the ladies to help her pick the perfect wedding gown, but the occasion gets heated when their tastes clash.
Christy discovers that she may be pregnant; Briana confronts her ex-husband about his new girlfriend; Tonya and Briana go speed dating; Terra and Tonya prepare for a stage performance.

The ladies attend a cooking class and discuss Tonya's love life. Meanwhile, Christy and Todd prepare for their wedding by dieting and enrolling in dance lessons; and Terra plans an intimate evening with Joe, after he fawns over Elena.
Elena considers getting breast implants; Terra tries to get the ladies to appear in a music video.

The ladies attend a wedding convention, where brides-to-be Traci and Christy start a bridal battle. Meanwhile, Elena discusses the possibility that she will have a baby who is a little person; and Terra tells Tonya that the man she's seeing might not be the good guy she thinks he is.
The ladies visit Las Vegas, and attend Traci and Christy's bachelorette parties. Later, the men arrive, and Christy tries to get Todd to elope.

Season 1 ends with Christy finalizing last-minute wedding details. Meanwhile, Terra and Joe feel pressure to discuss the future of their relationship; and the ladies suspect that Elena may be pregnant since she isn't drinking.

In the Season 2 premiere, Jason surprises the group with his new love interest; one of the ladies reveals that she's pregnant; and Jazmin's husband makes an announcement that starts a family feud. Later, an unexpected guest sends Lila over the edge.
Jazmin confronts Dawn about being a disappointing sister-in-law during an evening of belly dancing. Meanwhile, one of the ladies learns shocking news about her baby.
Dawn and Jazmin continue to drift apart; and Jason's attempt to plan a peaceful weekend for the group backfires. Later, a shocking secret is revealed that puts someone in danger.
The group is finally introduced to Katie's boyfriend. Later, the ladies' concern about the health of Katie and her baby leads to a dramatic confrontation during a visit to a pumpkin patch.
Dawn and David dig up details about the past, leading to explosive drama. Later, Jason makes a confession to DJ; and an unwelcome visitor crashes Katie's baby shower.
DJ asks Jason to move in with him; and Dawn learns about Lila's scandalous love life. Later, Lila and Dawn confront Katie about PJ.
In the second-season finale, baby Kinzley is born. Later, Dawn reveals one of Lila's deepest secrets to the others without her consent; and Jazmin must make a difficult decision.

The lives of a group of girlfriends living in New York City who happen to be little people are chronicled. In the opener, Elena visits Lila and meets the rest of the crew, but when she brings up a taboo topic Kristin has a panic attack.

Jason asks Jordanna and Kristin to help him talk to his parents about a sensitive issue; Jordanna confronts Lila for telling Elena about Kristin's divorce; Dawn makes unwelcome comments about Misty and Kristin's new apartment.
Jordanna invites Jazmin and the other ladies to perform in a burlesque show for her company, but Dawn tells Jazmin she shouldn't dance in the show because it's degrading.

Jordanna discovers a softer side to Dawn when they discuss her boyfriend and the problems they've been having. Meanwhile, Misty and Kristin invite the group to celebrate Mardi Gras; and Lila is tempted to break her sobriety when she is surrounded by her partying friends.

Christy McGinty from "Little Women: LA" gets Dawn and Jazmin to stage an intervention for Lila and confront her about her recent drinking. Meanwhile, Jordanna gets some bad news about her Broadway show; and Kristin visits a fertility doctor.

The ladies go on a ski trip to the Catskill Mountains where they are surrounded by friends who are partying and drinking, which causes Lila to struggle with her sobriety. Later, an explosive argument between Jazmin and Dawn leaves one of them in tears.

Misty and Jordanna go to war with each other when they are both asked to walk in a little person fashion show at New York Fashion Week. Jason and Kristin are forced to take sides when Misty and Jordanna fight for an opportunity to walk in the Paris fashion show later in the year.

Dawn asks her friends to help her host an art auction that will raise money for a women's charity in New York. She asks the group to create paintings of "lady parts" that Jason will then auction at the event. At the party, Jason and Jordanna get into an argument when he tries to auction her painting for $5.

Jazmin invites the group to go with her to Puerto Rico, but drama follows. Meanwhile, Dawn confronts Kristin for making nasty comments about her charity auction; and Jason and Jordanna's beef continues and comes to a climax during a day out on the water.

Season 1 ends with tension escalating between Misty and the rest of the group. Meanwhile, Kristin's mounting anxiety over her upcoming 38th birthday hits a fever pitch as the rest of the group tries to comfort her by throwing her an enormous '20s themed birthday bash; and Kristin's boyfriend unexpectedly shows up at the last minute.

In the Season 2 premiere, David Letterman travels to India to learn about the country's plans for expanding their energy grid with renewable resources. Later, comedian Cecily Strong investigates the issues with the solar energy industry within the U.S.
The outcome of the rising seas is discussed. Appearances by Jack Black and Ian Somerhalder.
An investigation of climate refugees and a look at the California drought.
The military, climate and deforestation are examined.
An investigation of how human behavior is impacting the oceans.
The threat of climate change and potential solutions are explored by Nikki Reed and Aasif Mandvi.

Bradley Whitford addresses Washington politicians who deny climate change. Later, tells the story of Jay Butera, of Citizens' Climate Lobby, who has brought congressmen of both parties together to develop legislative solutions to the issue.
Climate change and potential solutions are explored by America Ferrera and Sigourney Weaver.

Celebrities and journalists explore climate change around the world. In the opener, Harrison Ford investigates deforestation in Indonesia; Don Cheadle examines drought in Texas; and Thomas Friedman reports on stress caused by climate change in Syria.

Harrison Ford investigates the global effects of deforestation in Indonesia; Arnold Schwarzenegger joins an elite team of wildland firefighters as they battle a new breed of forest fires that are made more deadly by climate change.
Chris Hayes shadows Rep. Michael Grimm (R-N.Y.) as he surveys damage done by Hurricane Sandy; conservationist M. Sanjayan interviews top climate scientists around the world.

Lesley Stahl travels to Greenland to investigate the effects of global warming in the Arctic; Ian Somerhalder visits North Carolina to listen to both sides of an evangelical community's debate over climate change.

Olivia Munn profiles Washington's climate-conscious governor Jay Inslee; columnist Mark Bittman (New York Times) probes New Jersey governor Chris Christie's thoughts on man-made climate change in the wake of rebuilding after Hurricane Sandy.
America Ferrera profiles climate-change skeptic James M. Taylor of the Heartland Institute. Also: columnist Mark Bittman (New York Times) reports on natural gas.

Stories about the economic costs of climate change: Jessica Alba meets members of Climate Corps, who try to convince U.S. companies that sustainability can boost their bottom lines; Thomas Friedman examines how Kansas wheat fields impact Cairo; and Chris Hayes explores life after Hurricane Sandy.

Matt Damon investigates the impact of extreme heat on human health and mortality; Michael C. Hall reports on rising sea levels along the coast of Bangladesh; Thomas Friedman reports on how climate change is producing stress in Syria, Egypt and Yemen.

Season 1 ends with Michael C. Hall reporting on rising sea levels along the coast of Bangladesh. Also: M. Sanjayan questions top climate scientists and visits Tupungatito, the northernmost historically active stratovolcano in the southern Andes.
